text: Robert Knight (born Robert Peebles, Rick Simmons, "The Story Behind: Robert Knight, “Everlasting Love”", Rebeat, July 4, 2016. Retrieved 24 April 2017 April 24, 1945 - November 5, 2017) was an American R&B; singer. He was born in Franklin, Tennessee. He was best known for the 1967 recording of the song "Everlasting Love". Knight died at home in Nashville, Tennessee on November 5, 2017 after a short-illness, aged 72."Robert Knight, 'Everlasting Love' singer dead at 72", TMZ.com, 6 November 2017 ==References== ==Other websites== * Oldies.com Biography on Robert Knight * CMT.com artists page: Robert Knight Category:1945 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Tennessee Category:American R&B; singers Category:American soul musicians Category:American pop singers Category:Musicians from Tennessee Category:Singers from Tennessee
